revised_title: Investigating the Composition and Properties of Fluor Spar Compounds
tldr: In this study, Sir Humphry Davy examines the substances produced during various chemical processes on fluor spar. He investigates the composition of fluoric acid and its compounds, and through experiments, he proposes that fluoric acid is composed of hydrogen and a unique principle called fluorine, similar to chlorine. Davy also explores the properties of fluates and their decomposition, suggesting that fluorine may be a gaseous element.
